title: 8 Data-Based Tips To Help Leaders Win On LinkedIn In 2025
description: Here’s what our latest data says about how modern leaders are earning attention, building trust and driving real influence on LinkedIn in 2025.
content:
Justin Nassiri is the CEO of Executive Presence, helping companies build trust & awareness through executive thought leadership on LinkedIn.

In 2025, LinkedIn is no longer just a professional platform—it’s a leadership platform. We analyzed over 8,000 LinkedIn posts from C-level executives and founders, generating more than 37 million views and 500,000 engagements. The goal? To understand what’s actually working on the platform this year.

The short version: What worked in 2022 won’t cut it in 2025. The algorithm has evolved. So has audience behavior. And the bar for credibility has never been higher.

Here’s what our latest data says about how modern leaders are earning attention, building trust and driving real influence on LinkedIn this year:

Many executives still ask, “How often should I post?” We found that posting two to three times per week generated 57% more engagement per post than those who post once a week. Why? Frequency builds familiarity. It reduces the pressure to be perfect. And, most importantly, it keeps you visible. LinkedIn posts decay quickly—we found that most earn the majority of their views within 24 hours. If you’re only posting once a week, you’re invisible more than 85% of the time.

Despite fears of “scroll fatigue,” our research indicated that posts between 1,500 and 3,000 characters have the highest engagement rates (2.10%). Leaders who take the space to tell a story, break down an idea or reflect on a hard-earned lesson are rewarded with more interaction and deeper trust.

Short posts under 250 characters? They may be easy to write, but they rarely land. The takeaway: If you have something meaningful to say, say it well—and use line breaks to keep it digestible.

For the first time since we've been studying LinkedIn, video posts edged out images as the top-performing format (2.35% engagement vs. 2.32%). But before you start filming, consider this: The best-performing videos are native to the platform and insight-rich—not flashy, TikTok-style reels.

Image posts remain the most scalable and reliable tactic for most leaders. Meanwhile, resharing others’ posts or overusing carousels significantly underperforms. In fact, reshares earned less than half the engagement of original content.

4. Original thought is valued more than amplification.

The algorithm—and your audience—are clearly prioritizing authorship. Posts written directly by the executive generated twice the engagement of reshares, even when commentary was added. LinkedIn doesn’t just reward content. It rewards credibility. Audiences can feel when a post reflects personal insight rather than marketing polish.

Promotional posts—especially those focused on the company—are often seen as noise. When we crunched the numbers, educational content delivered a 42% higher engagement rate than promotional content. The lesson is that the more value you give away, the more attention you earn.

Interestingly, posts that mentioned the company by name did perform better, but only when paired with a personal lens. The winning formula: Lead with a story, insight or value, then tie it back to your company.

Similarly, when we categorized posts by content pillar, the highest engagement rates came from personal storytelling and leadership reflections. Authentic, reflective posts outperformed company updates, even when the topic was the same. If you’re trying to build executive presence on LinkedIn, don’t just tell people what your company does. Show them how you think and who you are as a leader.

Contrary to old advice, adding more than four relevant hashtags correlated with the highest engagement rates (2.2%) we saw. Hashtags may now play a stronger role in helping posts reach niche, high-intent audiences—especially in verticals like tech, venture capital and climate. I recommend using three to five well-targeted hashtags to clarify the focus of your post—not to chase trends.

Not surprisingly, leaders with larger audiences saw more reach. But what’s most important is how they got there. Frequent, consistent posting—not viral hits—was the common thread. Even executives with just a few thousand followers generated meaningful business results when their content was intentional and regular. Consistency is the compound interest of LinkedIn.

In a digital world full of noise, thought leadership isn’t about showing up. It’s about showing up with substance. The most successful executives on LinkedIn in 2025 are not just posting. They’re teaching through insight, leading through reflection and promoting with authenticity. And most importantly, they’re doing it consistently.

This isn’t a content game. It’s a credibility game. And the leaders who understand that are already winning.

Forbes Business Council Is A Vetted Professional Organization For Senior-Level Business Executives
Who is Forbes Business Council for?
Members of Forbes Business Council are respected owners, founders, and executive leaders of small and mid-sized businesses.
To qualify, your business must generate at least $500,000 USD in annual revenue, or have received $500,000 USD in funding to date.
Eligible applicants are vetted by our selection committee, and if approved, are invited to select and purchase a membership package.
Examples of council members include entrepreneurs who are either founders, partners, or executive leaders of small and medium-sized businesses.
Start Your Application
Why Join Forbes Business Council
Be Recognized As An Expert
Our platform allows you to easily share your business expertise through quick, concise quotes using our mobile app or web portal via Expert Panels. Members can select questions they have a unique perspective on and provide a response in under 400 characters. Then, the most apt responses are curated by our editorial team and distilled into a single piece.
Expert Panels are the ideal path to increasing your visibility while balancing a demanding schedule, and all include your name, company name, and link to your Executive Profile.
Publishing Bylined Articles on Forbes.com
Forbes Business Council members can submit bylined articles to be published on Forbes.com, each piece is edited collaboratively with our team of expert editors to meet the publication’s guidelines.
Articles are published on Forbes.com and syndicated across our social media channels, select pieces get extra promotion in our Biz Pulse newsletter. Articles feature your headshot and bio. You’ll also receive an author page on Forbes.com which includes your headshot, name, short-form bio, and a link to your full Executive Profile.
Your Executive Profile on Forbes.com
Your Executive Profile on Forbes.com is optimized to be search-friendly, affirming your credibility as a business leader. Profiles include your headshot, professional bio, company description, links to your social media and website, and all of the content you’ve been featured in on Forbes.com.
You’ll also receive an assortment of badging options for use on social media and business websites, highlighting your status as a Forbes Business Council member.
Forbes Business Council provides me a platform to connect, learn, and develop—a trifecta of personal and professional growth that you can't put a price on.
Sherry Taylor
Senior Regional Director, Office Depot
Additional Benefits for Forbes Councils Members
Connect, Learn, and Grow With Your Peers
Through our member portal and mobile app, you’ll be able to connect with a network of like-minded, successful entrepreneurs. As a member, you’ll be able to message others directly, share insights, pose questions, and participate in council-wide and group conversations.
With exclusive access to other owners, founders, and business leaders, the opportunities for business development and strategic partnerships are plenty.
Our members are committed to a lifetime of learning and growth. We host regular virtual events, led by a broad range of experts on the topics most relevant to you and your work, providing you the breadth of information required to address dynamic, real-time business challenges.
Interactive Groups
Within our exclusive member app, you’ll be able to join and create Groups — where you can connect, ask and answer questions, and start conversations with members of similar interests and industries.
Member Badges
As a member, you’ll have access to Forbes Councils badges, email signatures, social graphics, and press release templates. We make it easy for you to share your affiliation with the Forbes community.
Virtual Events
Be inspired by experts at virtual live events and in interactive member-led Groups. Our private events are hosted by industry experts in a variety of fields to address today’s critical issues.
Mobile App
Stay updated on the go with the Forbes Councils mobile app available on iOS and Android making it easy to participate in Expert Panels and connect with other members.
EXEC Benefits Program
You’ll receive complimentary access to EXEC, a curated hotel, travel, lifestyle, and business benefits program designed to improve the lives of busy executives.
Private Business Coaching
Available for an additional cost, you can get matched with a certified coach, who will guide you and your company to reach your highest professional and business goals.
Dedicated Member Support Team
At the core of the Forbes Councils experience is our member support team. Our team is dedicated to helping you get the most of your membership and resources.
Complimentary Strategy Session
Qualified members receive access to a free 30-minute strategy session with a premium business coach to help you discover hidden profit drivers and hone your focus.
Business Council
